I think they've really added a different kind of zest and a freshness to it, Michael Jackson said in a recent conference call. ''You take what was already great and you just kind of add a little extra spice to it.'' But the changes don't stop there. ''

by one with a technical free throw off an illegal defense, but Lynch answered with a short jumper over Shawn Bradley . The basket gave the 76ers a 99-98 lead, their first since midway through the third quarter. I went to the basket strong and shielded him off with my body, said Lynch, who is eight inches shorter than Shawn Bradley . New All-Star Michael Finley answered with a jumper at 28.4 seconds and appeared to be the hero again for Dallas when he snagged a rebound of Allen Iverson 's miss.

'' Eric Schmidt 's explanation of his role change is seen by many as a nice way of acknowledging what former Google designer Douglas Bowman said when he famously left the Internet giant in 2009: Yes, it's true that a team at Google couldn't decide between two blues, so they're testing 41 shades between each blue to see which one performs better. I had a recent debate over whether a border should be 3, 4 or 5 pixels wide, and was asked to prove my case. I can't operate in an environment like that. I've grown tired of debating such minuscule design decisions. There are more exciting design problems in this world to tackle. What else does the change mean? Check out some deeper concerns here. given the way we have split up our responsibilities.'' Eric Schmidt concurred in the same interview, saying Google's triumvirate decided they needed to find ways for the company to run more crisply. I am not as concerned about the titles as I am winning, Eric Schmidt said. ''I am quite certain that this change will result in faster decision making and better value for the shareholders.'' '' again, Betty White quips, ''I think you do a thing once and then you run like a thief.'' David Letterman then asks her what she does in her free time and Betty White says, Oh, I like to do most anything. Play with animals, mostly. And vodka's kind of a hobby. So David Letterman reaches down from behind the desk and produces a bottle of Grey Goose, to which Betty White laughs heartily. They share some vodka, then she does a classic spit-take. Naughty By Nature co-founder Vin Rock said that he was appreciative that such high profile personalities appreciated the hit-making group's longevity in the music business. They understood that we was celebrating 20-years in the game and they realized that entertainment, it's hard to be around for 20 years no matter what you do, Vin Rock told AllHipHop.com. ''Big up to Paul Schaffer. After we did soundcheck Paul wanted to get busy with us.'' Paul Schaffer is a legendary musician who has served as David Letterman 's bandleader

dominating pro football, in front of a mostly red-clad crowd that has helped turn the Falcons into a virtually unbeatable squad on its own field. ''None of that matters,'' Falcons safety William Moore said. When those lights come on, those players from the past ain't playing that night. It's just about who's going to come out and play ball that night. Atlanta has played some good ball ever since the new regime-- general manager Thomas Dimitroff and coach Mike Smith-- took over in 2008.
